newsitem.title: LATVIA: LATVIAN SHIPPING TO CUT LOSSES, INVEST MORE - REPORT.
newsitem.headline: LATVIAN SHIPPING TO CUT LOSSES, INVEST MORE - REPORT.

text.p: One of Latvia's largest companies, Latvian Shipping needs to invest in tanker and refrigerator fleets to keep their market share, the firm's acting president was quoted as saying in a newspaper on Thursday.
"We would not only invest in new ships but would also lease them and enter joint ventures with other ship operators," Andris Klavinsh, was quoted by Dienas Bizness as saying.
Latvian Shipping, currently due for privatisation, is among the largest refrigerator fleet operators in the world with 24 ships and one of the biggest tanker fleet's in Europe.
The company's audited 1996 results are due on June 20, the newspaper quoted the company's management as saying.
Latvian Shipping, which says it is the world's 19th largest shipping firm, has reported a $25 million loss in 1996 and a $51 million loss the year before.
The chairman of the company, Druvis Skulte, was reported by the newspaper as saying that it could cut its losses more in 1997 than by the previously planned $19 million.
The board plans to adjust the company's budget on a quarterly basis.
